description.raw:
Version 4.0 of tinyxml2 has just been released and is being used in homebrew. There is a small API change that causes gazebo7+ builds to fail (gazebo6 and earlier don't use tinyxml2). For some reason, there were two separate enums used to return success of an API call: `XML_NO_ERROR` and `XML_SUCCESS`. `XML_NO_ERROR` was [added first on Feb 21, 2012](https://github.com/leethomason/tinyxml2/commit/68db57e#diff-f0c986b0c387a2c34d4d6232c8d8c86bR576), though `XML_SUCCESS` was [added shortly after on Feb 27, 2012](https://github.com/leethomason/tinyxml2/commit/7d00b9ab#diff-f0c986b0c387a2c34d4d6232c8d8c86bR717). Both enums are present in the `libtinyxml2-dev` [package on trusty](http://packages.ubuntu.com/trusty/libtinyxml2-dev), which is based on the version from May 2012.

The `XML_NO_ERROR` enum was [removed recently on June 4, 2016](https://github.com/leethomason/tinyxml2/commit/8553625#diff-f0c986b0c387a2c34d4d6232c8d8c86bL488) and included in the 4.0.0 release. It should be fine to switch to using `XML_SUCCESS`, since that is available in the version on trusty.
description.html:
Version 4.0 of tinyxml2 has just been released and is being used in homebrew. There is a small API change that causes gazebo7+ builds to fail (gazebo6 and earlier don't use tinyxml2). For some reason, there were two separate enums used to return success of an API call: XML_NO_ERROR and XML_SUCCESS. XML_NO_ERROR was added first on Feb 21, 2012, though XML_SUCCESS was added shortly after on Feb 27, 2012. Both enums are present in the libtinyxml2-dev package on trusty, which is based on the version from May 2012.

The XML_NO_ERROR enum was removed recently on June 4, 2016 and included in the 4.0.0 release. It should be fine to switch to using XML_SUCCESS, since that is available in the version on trusty.

title.raw: Use XML_SUCCESS enum instead of XML_NO_ERROR, which has been deleted in tinyxml2 4.0
title.html: Use XML_SUCCESS enum instead of XML_NO_ERROR, which has been deleted in tinyxml2 4.0

For some reason, there were two separate enums used to return success of an API call: XML_NO_ERROR and XML_SUCCESS.
